name: Traditional Baba Ghanoush
author: IMANKAY
summary: A traditional recipe for this eggplant dip. It consists of baked eggplant with garlic, lemon juice, and tahini sauce. Dip into this with pita bread and you have yourself a delicious-and-light appetizer.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste
1 pinch dried parsley flakes, for garnish
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Arrange oven racks so you have one low and one high in the oven
Cut a shallow slit along the side of the eggplant and place into a baking dish
Roast in preheated oven on the lower rack until the eggplant is completely shrunken and soft, about 40 minutes
Move dish to higher rack and continue baking until the skin is charred, about 5 minutes more
Let eggplant cool until cool enough to handle
Peel and discard skin from eggplant
Put eggplant into a bowl; add tahini, garlic, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, and salt
Stir until ingredients are evenly mixed
Drizzle olive oil over the baba ghanoush and garnish with parsley
